pages.text: As your travels continue you just might find that 36 items just isn't enough ... especially if you spend much time mining.

Backpacks can carry up to 18 items and can be expanded several times, gaining an additional capacity of 9 with each expansion.$(br2)They can be enhanced further with specific upgrades, each adding new capabilities to your backpack.
The basic backpack.  It can carry up to 18 items.
A slightly larger pack.  It can carry up to 27 items as well as accepting a single upgrade.
An $(o)even$() larger pack.  It can carry up to 36 items as well as accepting two upgrades.
The largest and most versatile pack.  It can carry up to 45 items as well as accepting three upgrades.

pages.title: Dyeing
pages.text: Backpacks have an additional feature ... the ability to dye them whatever colour you like.$(br)Two colours, actually.$(br2)All you need to do is place your backpack in a crafting table with a dye to the left and right.$(br2)Or just a single dye, if that$(br)   is your desire.

pages.title: Placing
pages.text: Backpacks can also be placed on the ground (and picked back up) with a shift right-click and can be accessed as if it was a chest.$(br2)Just like chests they can be accessed via hoppers or pipes.

pages.title: Upgrades
pages.text: Upgrades can unlock the full potential of your pack, allowing you to automate input and output ... amongst other things.
The base upgrade.  It does nothing on its own, but it's required for all other upgrades.

This upgrade allows your pack to fill itself as you pick up items.  It can be filtered to only grab the specified items, or anything $(o)but$() the specified items.$(br2)Up to eight items can be$(br)   specified.

pages.title: Adv. Pickup Upgrade
pages.text: An advanced version of the Pickup Upgrade, this one can also filter by tags and/or mod as well as match durability or NBT.$(br) $(br2)Up to sixteen items can be specified.

This upgrade allows you to deposit items directly into a chest if you shift right-click the backpack against it.  It can be filtered the same as the Pickup Upgrade.$(br2)Up to eight items can be$(br)   specified.

pages.title: Adv. Deposit Upgrade
pages.text: An advanced version of the Deposit Upgrade, this one can also filter by tags and/or mod as well as match durability or NBT.$(br) $(br2)Up to sixteen items can be specified.

This upgrade allows you to restock items from a chest if you shift right-click the backpack against it.  It can be filtered the same as the Pickup Upgrade.$(br2)Up to eight items can be$(br)   specified.

pages.title: Adv. Restock Upgrade
pages.text: An advanced version of the Restock Upgrade, this one can also filter by tags and/or mod as well as match durability or NBT.$(br) $(br2)Up to sixteen items can be specified.

This upgrade allows you to filter items piped/hoppered into or out of the backpack when it is placed on the ground.  Filtering is the same as the Pickup Upgrade.$(br2)Up to eight items can be$(br)   specified.

pages.title: Adv. Filter Upgrade
pages.text: An advanced version of the Filter Upgrade, this one can also filter by tags and/or mod as well as match durability or NBT.$(br) $(br2)Up to sixteen items can be specified.
A $(o)very$() unique upgrade, this one makes your backpack $(o)truly$() indestructible.  It not only becomes immune to damage but it also cannot fall into the void or despawn.
